name: 03. "OCEAN FRAME"
description:
3/4 from “B-side” Collection.
The island of Mallorca is characterized by its castles, towers and fortresses located in beautiful surroundings. Due to their favorable location in the Mediterranean, the islands were coveted by many civilizations of the sea. 

Along the entire Majorcan coast you can still find defensive towers, which once served to warn the population of the arrival of corsairs and pirates, and which today are fantastic viewpoints over the sea.

The castle was built in the Gothic style at the beginning of the 14th century, with an original circular base. Here, in addition to the old dependencies of the Kings of Mallorca, you can visit the Municipal Museum of History, a collection of classical sculpture and the cell of Gaspar Melchor de Jovellanos.

It was built between 1300 and 1311 by order of King Jaime II of Mallorca as the residence of the kings of Mallorca and is one of the best examples of fortified civil 
and Gothic architecture in Mallorca. The castle has also been used as a refuge and prison throughout history.

Its original design stands out, with a circular base, unique in Spain. It is structured around a central patio, also circular, with four large towers oriented to the four cardinal points.
